summary: Philip LaChapelle Jr. was a former Security and Intelligence clerk. He is connected to the case of Kenneth C. Griggs, a PFC born in Korea who later defected. LaChapelle provided information about Griggs' experiences prior to his defection, including alleged mistreatment and emotional issues. He corresponded with Cecil L. Griggs, Kenneth's adopted father, in November 1967. The documents suggest LaChapelle had knowledge of Griggs' situation before his defection, making his communications relevant to understanding the circumstances surrounding Griggs' actions.
significance: Philip LaChapelle Jr.'s significance lies in his role as an information source regarding Kenneth C. Griggs prior to his defection. As a former Security and Intelligence clerk, his insights into Griggs' experiences, particularly any mistreatment or emotional issues, could shed light on the motivations behind Griggs' decision to defect. His correspondence with Cecil L. Griggs further underscores his involvement and potential knowledge of the events leading up to Griggs' defection.
